chapter.title: Introduction to Knowledge
chapter.para: Knowledge is an intuitive full featured web-based application designed to be used by individuals and organizations who need to manage their medical terminology requirements to improve healthcare delivery, outcomes, and reimbursement. The following chapters describe the functionality that enables the creation of new content, the modification of content, and releasing content to satisfy customers needs.

Knowledge is based on Solor
â€“ Logica's
Open Source project. Mind Computing uses Solor to create Knowledge a web-based application. Knowledge can import locally created content and integrate it with Meaningful Use Standards (SNOMED CT, LOINC, and RxNorm). Extensions to Solor and SNOMED CT can be exported by Knowledge to distribute to customers.

The Knowledge application has three components the: Editor, Manager, and a Terminology Server. The Knowledge Editor provides all authoring functionality, such as creating new concepts, modify concepts, creating value sets, modifying value sets, classifying, search, mapping and exporting content. The Knowledge Manager provides the functionality to create new users and modify a user's role.
